basics.name: Denny Huang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S in Computer Science and a B.A in Quantitative Economics at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in the Fall of 2027.

highlights: Implemented a secure deterministic IP obfuscation method after comparing various techniques, successfully hashing 1.5M+ sensitive IP addresses to prevent overfitting by the model.

Achieved 87% clustering purity and 0.73 silhouette score across 6 user roles by training a K-Means model on PCA-reduced features and visualizing clusters with t-SNE, enabling accurate user role predictions.
Achieved 89% accuracy in predicting anomalies on network traffic data by engineering features and training a neural network, enhancing the detection of potential security threats.
Reduced incident resolution time by 45% and improved SLA compliance to 98% by implementing a scalable SaaSincident management system, reducing ticket response and resolution time.
Assisted in resolving 20+ ticket incidents daily by troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues, mitigating downtime for employees.
Created comprehensive documentation and user guides for common IT issues, reducing repeat incidents by 30% and empowering users to resolve minor issues independently.

Engineered a high-performance data pipeline to clean and preprocess 1M+ raw global climate records, leveraging Pandas and NumPy for efficient data manipulation and establishing a normalized data foundation for downstream analysis.

Identified a 0.82 correlation between sea surface temperature and CO2 emissions across 5+ major ocean regions by developing custom geospatial visualizations using Matplotlib and Cartopy, directly informing climate trend research.

Communicated high-impact research findings to a diverse academic audience, including faculty, researchers, and students, to drive subsequent discussion on new departmental climate modeling initiatives.
Directed 10+ service projects and contributed 50+ volunteer hours, strengthening community engagement.
Engaged 50+ students and achieved 90% attendance, launching a coding program at Moanalua High School and leading lessons to foster early interest in computer science.
